arts.ttl: Mateo Kovacic explains how Man City are replacing Rodri
arts.sum: Speaking after Saturday's win, Kovacic revealed: "I am playing there in the middle at the moment and of course we need to cover for Rodri, we miss him a lot. Mateo Kovacic says Manchester City need to adapt to life without Rodri after scoring twice in their nervy 3-2 victory over Fulham on Saturday.

arts.ttl: X reacts to surprise title race drama as Arsenal and Man City struggle to victory
arts.sum: Arsenal and Manchester City were made to sweat on Saturday afternoon despite both securing victory to keep pace with Liverpool at the summit of the Premier League. There was little to write home about during a frustrating first half for Arsenal at the Emirates Stadium but the same couldn't be said of the opening 45 minutes at the Etihad Stadium.

arts.ttl: Ricci: ‘Manchester City talk pleasing, but I’m not big-headed’
arts.sum: Manchester City scouts were reportedly in the stands to watch Samuele Ricci during Inter 3-2...

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola picks out Fulham star who ‘no one can stop’
arts.sum: Pep Guardiola hailed Adama Traore as an unstoppable force after Manchester City came from behind to beat Fulham at Craven Cottage on Saturday. The Whites took the lead through Andreas Pereira in the first half, but Mateo Kovacic levelled matters soon after. The Croat struck again just after the interval to put the visitors ahead. […] The post Pep Guardiola picks out Fulham star who ‘no one can stop’ first appeared on The Football Faithful.

arts.ttl: Report: Manchester City now eyeing £60m Rodri replacement who Liverpool looked at this summer
arts.sum: Manchester City continued to win at home this weekend but they know they have a big decision to make on potentially replacing star midfielder Rodri...

arts.sum: All of the latest Man City headlines wrapped up on Saturday, October 5

arts.ttl: Man United, Man City, Liverpool 'suffer major blow' in Jamal Musiala pursuit
arts.sum: Bayern Munich sporting director Max Eberl is "very confident" when it comes to a potential new contract for German attacker Jamal Musiala.

arts.sum: Manchester City scouts are at San Siro for Samuele Ricci, so Torino director Davide Vagnati...

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola insists leaky Manchester City defence doesn’t worry him
arts.athr: Jamie Jackson at the Etihad Stadium
arts.sum: City went 1-0 down at home for third time this season Guardiola praise for two-goal midfielder Mateo Kovacic Pep Guardiola denied he has any concerns about Manchester City’s defence after they conceded the first goal in their 3-2 win against Fulham, after doing so earlier in the season in the victories over Ipswich and Brentford. Andreas Pereira scored the opener for Marco Silva’s side in the 26th minute. Against Ipswich in August Sam Szmodics did the same after seven minutes and Yoane Wissa for the Bees inside a minute at the Etihad last month. Guardiola was asked if this was a cause for worry. “I would say except Wissa against Brentford, in the other ones we were playing good,” he said. “It’s not nice to come back from 0-1 but we created chances today to go 1-0 and 2-0.” Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Pep Guardiola insists Man City star has sent warning to rivals after Fulham showing
arts.sum: Manchester City claimed a hard-fought 3-2 win over Fulham at the Etihad Stadium on Saturday afternoon, with Mateo Kovacic, standing in for the injured Rodri, scoring twice and Jeremy Doku nabbing the winner
